fields.description:
When we move to systemd we can start some supporting services using unit dependencies rather than explicitly starting them all. Other commands, such as chkconfig, may need to be rewritten to use systemctl instead. We may also need to call sysctl rather than relying on init scripts to do that.

In EUCA-10398 we should hopefully discover exactly what those changes are.  In EUCA-11749 we will refine that set of changes as we script making everything work.
fields.summary: Update installation and admin guides for systemd conversion

comments.body: Sprint 2 plan is to update the docs in MASTER branch to get this work started. The dev work will likely continue over the 4.3 release, so will probably need tweaks to stay in sync with that work.

The current assumption is that RHEL 6 will not be supported on 4.3. However, I will use this ticket to _identify_ RHEL 6 specific doc content. I will not yet remove it. So RHEL 7 specific info will be _added_ for this sprint.

The RHEL 6 assumption (8 Jan 16 comment) might be going away, at least as I heard today. [~gholms] it looks like you've done / got a lot of work under EUCA-10398. It might be prudent to push this ticket to the next sprint? Unless you have some pieces that you _really_ would like to see doc'd now, before it has been too long? Please advise. thanks!

[~gholms] [~mbacchi] is it possible for one of you to update the description of this ticket to be more explicit? Is it this:
if doc mentions chkconfig, update to systemctl
if doc mentions service, update to systemctl
...
Or does somebody need to mark-up the install / admin guides where changes are required? Did [~jhalterman] catch the changes in DOC-1839?

related - https://access.redhat.com/sites/default/files/attachments/rhel_5_6_7_cheatsheet_27x36_1014_jcs_web.pdf
[~mbacchi] need feedback please and thank you!

https://access.redhat.com/articles/754933 Comparing systemd to Traditional init - did some of the work with DOC-1839

added commits via this ticket to update Install Guide - verify this is complete!
and Admin Guide - multiple commits.

Admin Guide - I changed init.d type entries like so:
/etc/init.d/eucalyptus-cloud restart changed to:
/lib/systemd/system/systemctl restart eucalyptus-cloud.service

STILL QUESTIONS: 
iptables 
postgresql-9.1

Also - console guide updated
Thanks, [~mbacchi] I checked in today based on your feedback.

[~kmeredith] for your questions above:

iptables:
I haven't yet but will rewrite this section for you, look for it by Monday in email.

postgresql-9.1:
we don't have an updated data warehouse package yet for 4.3, and won't have time to do anything about it until after the GA.  I say we should leave the docs alone on this subject for now, and we will revisit when we figure out the plan for the package (which might be deprecating it, [~tony] already thought it was deprecated.)

[~mbacchi] please confirm that ALL cases whenever we used:
-eucalyptus-nc 
-eucalyptus-cc
Now use:
-eucalyptus-node
-eucalyptus-cluster
... is correct?
[~kmeredith] Yes all instances should be changed.  Thanks.
The only time the old names would be necessary are on RHEL 6, which probably just means select portions of the upgrade instructions.
hey [~mbacchi] I think this ticket's work is now complete, other than the iptables thing you are going to give me tomorrow :) thanks

Thanks [~kmeredith] this also looks good now.  I reviewed the changes [~jhalterman] gave you re: iptables and other items and it looks good for now.

I am creating a todo item for myself to deal with the data warehouse question, whether we will build a package for RHEL 7 using bodega or deprecate it and remove the documentation about it.
Created the linked issue so we can close this out. Thanks [~mbacchi]!
